clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Reliability of Oesophageal Temperature in THOracic Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Reliability of Oesophageal Temperature in THOracic Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Controlling hypothermia is essential in anesthesia to limit postoperative complications. Temperature monitoring is therefore essential. However, the reliability of esophageal temperature during open chest lung surgery is discussed and not accurately assessed in the literature.

detailed_description.textblock:
Controlling hypothermia is essential in anesthesia to limit postoperative complications. Temperature monitoring is therefore essential. However, the reliability of esophageal temperature during open chest lung surgery is discussed and not accurately assessed in the literature.
The investigators therefore decided to evaluate the reliability of the oesophageal temperature in open chest lung surgery by comparing it to the continuous tympanic temperature.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between tympanic and oesophageal temperature.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the correlation existing between the tympanic temperature, reflection of the central temperature without variation with an open thorax, and oesophageal temperature subject to changes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference of correlation between tympanic and oesophageal temperature during left and right thoracotomy.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the correlation existing between the tympanic temperature, reflection of the central temperature without variation with an open thorax, and oesophageal temperature subject to changes.

arm_group.description: All patients needing pulmonary surgery under thoracotomy

intervention.description: Tympanic and oesophageal temperatures will be recorded during the procedure

study_pop.textblock: All adults inpatients with thoracotomy surgery, in our University hospital in France

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients needing pulmonary surgery under thoracotomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient refusal
- esophageal or otological pathology preventing the installation of thermal probes
